title: Adrie van Kraay
text:
Adrianus Ambrosius Cornelis van Kraaij (born 1 August 1953 in <a href="Eindhoven">Eindhoven</a>, <a href="North%20Brabant">North Brabant</a>), commonly known as Adrie van Kraay, is a retired <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="central%20defender">central defender</a> from the Netherlands.
Career.
Van Kraaij represented <a href="Netherlands%20national%20football%20team">his native country</a> at the <a href="1978%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1978 FIFA World Cup</a> in <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>, wearing the number four jersey. He played for <a href="PSV%20Eindhoven">PSV Eindhoven</a> from 1971 until 1982, making 309 appearances and five scores for his club. At the end of his career, he had short spells at <a href="K.%20Waterschei%20S.V.%20Thor%20Genk">K. Waterschei S.V. Thor Genk</a> of Belgium and <a href="FC%20Basel">FC Basel</a> of Switzerland. From 2008 until 2010, Van Kraay was director of football at PSV Eindhoven, after <a href="Stan%20Valckx">Stan Valckx</a> left the club.
